description: A drawing showing the location of countries or roads.
A small hotel usually in the countryside.
A journey where you visit different places.
A permit to enter another country.
A budget place for travelers to stay overnight.
A planned route or journey.
The type of money used in a particular country.
A bag carried on the back to hold belongings.
A famous building or object that helps people know where they are.
A thing that is kept as a reminder of a place.
A long journey for a specific purpose.
A very large and busy city.
A group of many islands.
A tool that shows direction.
The place where someone is going.
A long narrow sea inlet bordered by steep cliffs.
A spherical model of Earth.
An area lying beyond what is visible or known.
Feeling tired because of a long flight across different time zones.
A small narrow boat you move with a paddle.
Bags and suitcases packed for travel.
A person who moves from place to place.
A fertile spot in a desert where water is found.
A document needed to enter or leave a country.
A platform along the water for loading and unloading ships.
A ridge of jagged rock, coral, or sand just above or below the sea.
An expedition to observe animals in their natural habitat.
A departure and arrival area for air or ground travel.
To discover something hidden, lost, or kept secret by investigation or searching.
A long journey involving travel by sea or in space.
A strong desire to travel and explore the world.
An individual who is attracted to foreign peoples, cultures, or customs.
A medium-sized sailboat equipped for cruising or racing.
A large German airship of the early 20th century.
A large open space within a building, often featuring a glass roof.
A market in a Middle Eastern country.
A group of people traveling together for mutual protection, often with vehicles or camels.
A landform at the mouth of a river where it splits into several outlets.
An imaginary line around the middle of the Earth, equidistant from the North and South Poles.
A boat or ship for conveying passengers and goods, especially over a relatively short distance and as a regular service.
A long narrow flat-bottomed boat with a high prow and stern, used on the canals of Venice.
The line at which the earth's surface and the sky appear to meet.
A piece of land surrounded by water.
A landing stage or small pier at which boats can dock or be moored.
A small open-fronted hut or cubicle from which newspapers, refreshments, tickets, etc., are sold.
A stretch of salt water separated from the sea by a low sandbank or coral reef.
To follow a winding course.
Relating to sailors, ships, or navigation.
The remote and usually uninhabited inland regions of Australia.
A structure leading out from the shore into a body of water.
